title: Coronavirus: What does the latest UK advice mean?
description: The BBC's Laura Foster explains what the UK government's next stage of response to the virus in the UK means for everyday life.

title: UK sport effectively cancelled as PM advises against mass gatherings
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson advises against mass gatherings amid the coronavirus outbreak - effectively cancelling all remaining sporting events.

title: Coronavirus: Q&A as Uefa meet to discuss Euro 2020 & Champions League
description: What will happen to Euro 2020? What about the Champions League? BBC Sport's Simon Stone looks ahead to Uefa's crisis meeting.

title: Why Texas is saying 'no' to all new refugees
description: Texas' longstanding reputation for hospitality has taken a hit as it embraces a new Trump refugee plan.

title: Coronavirus elderly advice: How can I look after my older relatives?
description: What measures are being taken and what advice is there for looking after older and elderly people?

title: Coronavirus: Empty streets throughout the world
description: A gallery of empty streets in towns and cities around the world due to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Coronavirus kindness: The people offering help as the virus spreads
description: Alongside the stories of stockpiling and panic buying, people are also helping others.

title: How to argue with a racist: Five myths debunked
description: Stereotypes and myths about race are not just used by racists. Here's how to debunk five myths.

title: Bethany Hamilton: Meet the elite surfer who lost an arm to a shark attack
description: Bethany Hamilton, who lost an arm in a shark attack as a teenager, is aiming to qualify for the elite World Surf League Championship Tour in 2021 after having her second child.

title: Coronavirus kindness: Hand sanitiser donated to homeless by gym boss
description: Luke Willmott says it is important to "help each other" after supplies empty in supermarkets.

title: Are you kidding? Goats on roofs in the Rhondda
description: Trouble the goat has been living up to his name, along with companion Mabel at their valleys home.

title: BBC to delay over-75 TV licence fee changes
description: Millions were due to lose free licences on 1 June, but coronavirus means it's "not the right time".

title: Coronavirus: Germany latest country to close borders
description: Only goods and workers can pass, with France also warning its situation is "deteriorating fast".

title: Coronavirus: No 10 to start daily briefings
description: The decision comes after opposition MPs called for greater clarity over the government's response.

title: Coronavirus: Iceland store to open early for older shoppers
description: The move comes as supermarkets continue to limit the sales of certain products to avoid them selling out.

title: Beatles' Magical Mystery Tour piano sketches found in skip
description: The designs for Sir Paul McCartney's piano are part of a collection that could sell for £10,000.

title: Coronavirus: Stocks plunge despite global central bank action
description: FTSE 100 dives 6% despite central banks announcing a co-ordinated effort to ease the coronavirus impact.

title: Mini-tournament could decide Champions League and Europa League
description: A mini-tournament to decide the Champions League and Europa League will be one option put forward to ease fixture congestion caused by the coronavirus outbreak.

title: No decisions yet on next steps - EFL
description: The English Football League says it has yet to decide what may happen next after games were suspended until at least 3 April.

title: Airlines slash more flights as coronavirus hits
description: Ryanair says it may have to ground its entire fleet, while the owner of BA cuts 75% of its capacity

title: Roy Hudd, actor and comic, dies aged 83
description: The entertainer presented the News Huddlines and played Archie Shuttleworth in Coronation Street.

title: Coronavirus kindness: Constantine Bay's early-morning shopping club
description: The idea is to let older, higher risk customers shop without coming into contact with young people.

title: Coronavirus: US man who stockpiled hand sanitiser probed for price gouging
description: Matt Colvin, from Tennessee in the US, bought 17,700 bottles of hand gel to re-sell on Amazon.

title: Future of rugby league as a sport 'on the line' - Saints chairman McManus
description: St Helens chairman Eamonn McManus says the government may have to help rugby league clubs due to coronavirus.

title: Premier League Hall of Fame ceremony cancelled
description: The inaugural Premier League Hall of Fame ceremony scheduled for Thursday is cancelled because of the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Satoshi Uematsu: Japanese man who killed 19 disabled people sentenced to death
description: Satoshi Uematsu said disabled people who were unable to communicate well had no human rights.

title: The Papers: 'Pull together' for elderly as virus sees banks act
description: Some of Monday's papers focus on examples of community spirit brought about by the coronavirus crisis.

title: Australian man charged over supermarket 'assault'
description: The alleged assault in Sydney took place as other shoppers argued over stockpiling items.

title: GPs prepare for NHS's 'biggest crisis'
description: Family doctors are gearing up for a major increase in coronavirus in the community. How will they cope?

title: Domestic homicide: 'The violence my sister suffered was horrendous'
description: Caroline Crossan was murdered by her husband in 1997 in what was described as a "savage" assault.

title: Autism: How to talk to a child about their autism
description: Tips from a mum on how to talk to a child about their autism.

title: The Cashmere crisis in the Himalayan ice desert
description: Photographer Andrew Newey has documented the lives of the Changpa nomads and the threat to Cashmere wool.

title: Coronavirus: How to protect your mental health
description: Advice on protecting your mental health during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Coronavirus clears Venice of crowds
description: A Venice resident shows us how the city has been completely transformed by the coronavirus shutdown.

title: Ethiopia's missing students: Families' pain and the unsolved mystery
description: The government has been slow to resolve the issue linked to the country's ethnic tensions.

title: The Boss: Male investors didn't get my billion-dollar idea
description: How fashion boss Katrina Lake was able to succeed despite having to battle sexism.

title: The 'climate doomers' preparing for society to fall apart
description: Few scientists think climate change will cause society to collapse any time soon - but some people are getting ready anyway.
